title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 1. The Dietitians Registration Board Approved Qualifications Bye-Law
text_raw:
1. The Dietitians Registration Board Approved Qualifications Bye-Law 
2019 (S.I. No. 231 of 2019) is hereby revoked with effect from the date specified 
in paragraph (2.(2)), without prejudice to any applications for registration or 
restoration received by the board prior to that date.
text_norm: 1 dietitian registration board approved qualification bye-law 2019 (s.i no 231 2019) hereby revoked effect date specified paragraph (2.(2)) without prejudice application registration restoration received board prior date

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 2. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Dietitians Registration Board
text_raw:
2. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Dietitians Registration Board 

Approved Qualifications Bye-Law 2020. 

(2) The bye-law comes into operation on 20 May 2020.
text_norm: 2 (1) bye-law may cited dietitian registration board approved qualification bye-law 2020 (2) bye-law come operation 20 may 2020

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: In the bye-law –
text_raw:
3. 

In the bye-law – 

“the Act” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 
(no.27 of 2005) (as amended from time to time); 

“the Register” means the register of the Dietitians Registration Board 
established under section 36(1)(a) of the Act.
text_norm: 3 bye-law - act mean health social care professional act 2005 (no.27 2005) (as amended time time) register mean register dietitian registration board established section 36(1)(a) act

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: 4. The Dietitians Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(a)
text_raw:
4. The Dietitians Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 38(2)(a) 
of the Act, hereby approves the following qualifications as attesting to the 
standard of proficiency required for registration in the Register: 

(1) Bachelor of Science in Human Nutrition and Dietetics, Dublin Institute 

of Technology and the University of Dublin, 

(2) Bachelor of Science in Human Nutrition and Dietetics, Technological 

University Dublin and the University of Dublin, 

(3) Bachelor of Science in Human Nutrition and Dietetics from the 
University of Dublin, and a Graduate Diploma in Human Nutrition and Dietetics 
from the Dublin Institute of Technology, 

(4) Master of Science in Clinical Nutrition and Dietetics, National 

University of Ireland, University College Dublin. 

(5) Master of Science (MSc) Human Nutrition and Dietetics, University of 

Limerick. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 22nd May, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [176] 3 

GIVEN under the seal of the Dietitians Registration 
Board, 

20 May 2020. 

NICK KENNEDY 

Chairperson, Dietitians Registration Board, 

MARY FLYNN 

Member, Dietitians Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [176]
text_norm: 4 dietitian registration board purpose section 38(2)(a) act hereby approves following qualification attesting standard proficiency required registration register (1) bachelor science human nutrition dietetics dublin institute technology university dublin (2) bachelor science human nutrition dietetics technological university dublin university dublin (3) bachelor science human nutrition dietetics university dublin graduate diploma human nutrition dietetics dublin institute technology (4) master science clinical nutrition dietetics national university ireland university college dublin (5) master science (msc) human nutrition dietetics university limerick notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 22nd may 2020 176 3 given seal dietitian registration board 20 may 2020 nick kennedy chairperson dietitian registration board mary flynn member dietitian registration board 4 176

title: section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as amended),
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law identifies the qualifications awarded in the State which are 
approved by the Dietitians Registration Board as attesting to the standard of 
proficiency required for registration with the Dietitians Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [176] 5
